    • Field Detail

      • alphahull

        @Option
public Double alphahull
        Determines how the mesh surface triangles are derived from the set of vertices (points) represented by the "x", "y" and "z" arrays, if the "i", "j", "k" arrays are not supplied. For general use of "mesh3d" it is preferred that "i", "j", "k" are supplied. If "-1", Delaunay triangulation is used, which is mainly suitable if the mesh is a single, more or less layer surface that is perpendicular to "delaunayaxis". In case the "delaunayaxis" intersects the mesh surface at more than one point it will result triangles that are very long in the dimension of "delaunayaxis". If ">0", the alpha-shape algorithm is used. In this case, the positive "alphahull" value signals the use of the alpha-shape algorithm, _and_ its value acts as the parameter for the mesh fitting. If "0", the convex-hull algorithm is used. It is suitable for convex bodies or if the intention is to enclose the "x", "y" and "z" point set into a convex hull.

        Default: -1

      • autocolorscale

        @Option
public Boolean autocolorscale
        Has an effect only if "color" is set to a numerical array. Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette ("autocolorscale: true") or the palette determined by "colorscale". In case "colorscale" is unspecified or "autocolorscale" is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the "color" array are all positive, all negative or mixed.

      • cauto

        @Option
public Boolean cauto
        Has an effect only if "color" is set to a numerical array and "cmin", "cmax" are set by the user. In this case, it controls whether the range of colors in "colorscale" is mapped to the range of values in the "color" array ("cauto: true"), or the "cmin"/"cmax" values ("cauto: false").

        Default: false (when "cmin", "cmax" are set by the user)

      • cmax

        @Option
public Integer cmax
        Has an effect only if "color" is set to a numerical array. The upper bound of the color domain. Value should be associated to the "color" array index, and if set, "cmin" must be set as well.

      • cmin

        @Option
public Integer cmin
        Has an effect only if "color" is set to a numerical array. The lower bound of the color domain. Value should be associated to the "color" array index, and if set, "cmax" must be set as well.

      • color$array

        @Option(value="color")
public int[] color$array
        Alternate form. See colorscale$array.

      • color$string

        @Option(value="color")
public String color$string
        The color of the whole mesh.

      • colorbar

        @Option
public final ColorbarOptions colorbar
        Options for color bar display.

      • colorscale$array

        @Option(value="colorscale")
public Object[] colorscale$array
        The colorscale and only has an effect if "color" is set to a numerical array. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, "[[0, "rgb(0,0,255)", [1, "rgb(255,0,0)"]]". To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use "cmin" and "cmax".

      • colorscale$string

        @Option(value="colorscale")
public String colorscale$string
        Alternatively, "colorscale" may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys, YlGnBu, Greens, YlOrRd, Bluered, RdBu, Reds, Blues, Picnic, Rainbow, Portland, Jet, Hot, Blackbody, Earth, Electric, Viridis, Cividis

      • contour_color

        @Option(value="contour.color")
public String contour_color
        The color of the contour lines.

        Default: "#444"

      • contour_show

        @Option(value="contour.show")
public Boolean contour_show
        Determines whether or not dynamic contours are shown on hover.

      • contour_width

        @Option(value="contour.width")
public Integer contour_width
        The width of the contour lines.

        Default: 2

      • delaunayaxis

        @Option
public PlotMesh3D.AxisSelectorEnum delaunayaxis
        The Delaunay axis, which is the axis that is perpendicular to the surface of the Delaunay triangulation. It has an effect if "i", "j", "k" are not provided and "alphahull" is set to indicate Delaunay triangulation.

        Default: Z

      • facecolor

        @Option
public String[] facecolor
        The color of each face Overrides "color" and "vertexcolor".

      • flatshading

        @Option
public Boolean flatshading
        Determines whether or not normal smoothing is applied to the meshes, creating meshes with an angular, low-poly look via flat reflections.

      • i

        @Option
public int[] i
        A vector of vertex indices, i.e. integer values between 0 and the length of the vertex vectors, representing the "first" vertex of a triangle. For example, "{i[m], j[m], k[m]}" together represent face m (triangle m) in the mesh, where "i[m] = n" points to the triplet "{x[n], y[n], z[n]}" in the vertex arrays. Therefore, each element in "i" represents a point in space, which is the first vertex of a triangle.

      • intensity

        @Option
public double[] intensity
        The vertex intensity values, used for plotting fields on meshes.

      • j

        @Option
public int[] j
        A vector of vertex indices, i.e. integer values between 0 and the length of the vertex vectors, representing the "second" vertex of a triangle. For example, "{i[m], j[m], k[m]}" together represent face m (triangle m) in the mesh, where "j[m] = n" points to the triplet "{x[n], y[n], z[n]}" in the vertex arrays. Therefore, each element in "j" represents a point in space, which is the second vertex of a triangle.

      • k

        @Option
public int[] k
        A vector of vertex indices, i.e. integer values between 0 and the length of the vertex vectors, representing the "third" vertex of a triangle. For example, "{i[m], j[m], k[m]}" together represent face m (triangle m) in the mesh, where "k[m] = n" points to the triplet "{x[n], y[n], z[n]}" in the vertex arrays. Therefore, each element in "k" represents a point in space, which is the third vertex of a triangle.

      • lighting

        @Option
public final LightingOptions lighting
        Options for lighting effect.

      • lightposition_x

        @Option(value="lightposition.x")
public Double lightposition_x
        Numeric vector, representing the X coordinate for each vertex.

        Default: 100000

      • lightposition_y

        @Option(value="lightposition.y")
public Double lightposition_y
        Numeric vector, representing the Y coordinate for each vertex.

        Default: 100000

      • lightposition_z

        @Option(value="lightposition.z")
public Double lightposition_z
        Numeric vector, representing the Z coordinate for each vertex.

        Default: 0

      • reversescale

        @Option
public Boolean reversescale
        Has an effect only if "color" is set to a numerical array. Reverses the color mapping if true ("cmin" will correspond to the last color in the array and "cmax" will correspond to the first color).

      • scene

        @Option
public String scene
        Reference between this trace's 3D coordinate system and a 3D scene. If "scene" (the default value), the (x,y,z) coordinates refer to "layout.scene". If "scene2", the (x,y,z) coordinates refer to "layout.scene2", and so on.

      • showscale

        @Option
public Boolean showscale
        Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace.

        Default: true

      • text$array

        @Option(value="text")
public String[] text$array
        The text elements associated with the vertices. If trace "hoverinfo" contains a "text" flag and "hovertext" is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

      • text$string

        @Option(value="text")
public String text$string
        The text elements associated with the vertices to the same value. If trace "hoverinfo" contains a "text" flag and "hovertext" is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

      • vertexcolor

        @Option
public String[] vertexcolor
        The color of each vertex. Overrides "color".

      • x

        @Option
public double[] x
        The X coordinates of the vertices. The nth element of vectors "x", "y" and "z" jointly represent the X, Y and Z coordinates of the nth vertex.

      • xcalendar

        @Option
public CalendarTypeEnum xcalendar
        The calendar system to use with "x" date data.

        Default: GREGORIAN

      • y

        @Option
public double[] y
        The Y coordinates of the vertices. The nth element of vectors "x", "y" and "z" jointly represent the X, Y and Z coordinates of the nth vertex.

      • ycalendar

        @Option
public CalendarTypeEnum ycalendar
        The calendar system to use with "y" date data.

        Default: GREGORIAN

      • z

        @Option
public double[] z
        The Z coordinates of the vertices. The nth element of vectors "x", "y" and "z" jointly represent the X, Y and Z coordinates of the nth vertex.

      • zcalendar

        @Option
public CalendarTypeEnum zcalendar
        The calendar system to use with "z" date data.

        Default: GREGORIAN
